challonge: Uses Challonge's API to pull data into Discord
coin-flip: A coin is flipped and the result is returned, either heads or tails.
edit: There are multiple settings that can be edited to allow customization. If multiple channels are listed, the setting will be updated to the same value across all listed channels.
refresh: Sends a "REFRESH THE BRACKET" reminder into the chat.
remind: Allows the admin to set a timed reminder
reset: Resets the round count back to its default value
round: Changes the current round number to the new value. Immediately sends a status update in the chat.

botrole: Returns the role that allows access to the administrator commands
bracket: Shows the current bracket set in the channel
draw: Draws 7 random characters and conducts a ban pick system. Must mention a user. Will use SFV characters if no game is specified.
github: Links to the GitHub repository for Lizard-BOT
help-lizard: For more information about the bot and its commands: <https://github.com/lizardman301/Lizard-bot-rsf>
lizardbot-discord: Displays the invite link to join the Lizard-BOT Discord Server for additional help
not-in-discord: Explains why somebody's name appears on the NOT IN DISCORD list
pingtest: Explains how to run a ping test using <https://testmyspeed.onl/> and a common server
prefix-lizard: Prints the prefix currently in use for Lizard-BOT
randomselect: Returns a randomly selected character from the game in the arguments. Will return a SFV character if no game is given.
stats: Returns the usage for Lizard-BOT commands
status: Returns the current round number in a message that can be customized
stream: Returns the stream link if one is set
TOs: Sends a message back with all the Tournament Organizers pinged once set

checkin: Checks the given bracket for users that are not checked in and users whose Challonge names are not in the server
seeding: Seeds the tournament based on points in the spreadsheet and the number of players to seed

botrole:
This role determines what role is needed to access the TO Commands
New value must be a ping to the role desired
Default value: @everyone
bracket:
Allows you to add a link to a bracket for users to view
Unique for each channel
Default value: 'There is no bracket set for this channel'
challonge:
Specifies the challonge subdomain to check for tournaments
Necessary for Challonge integration
Default Value:
pingtest:
Allows you to set a message for players to do a ping test
Default Value: Use <https://testmyspeed.onl/> for ping tests.
prefix-lizard:
Allows you to change the prefix for commands
Useful if you use multiple bots that may have similar commands and prefixes
Default Value: !
seeding:
Allows you to set the Google Sheets spreadsheet ID to be used to check points
Please see: [Our Documentation](https://github.com/lizardman301/Lizard-bot-rsf/blob/master/doc/seeding_with_sheets.md) for instructions on creating/adapting a spreadsheet
Unique for each channel
Default value:
status:
Allows you to change the flavor text of the !round and !status commands for individual channels
Text uses {0} as a marker for where the round count will be added
Unique for each channel
Default value: Winner's Round {0} can play! Losers can play till top 8 losers side. If you have a bye Round {0}, Please Wait!
stream:
Allows you to add a stream link that users can ping to get a link of
Unique for each channel
Default value: There are no streams set for this channel
tos:
Allows you to list all Tournament Organizers involved
Recommended to make it ping each individual TO
Unique for each channel
Default value:
